_header: God be in my head and in my understanding
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 480; Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 483; for a later 10-line version see Brough Hall Sarum Horae, title page, X
Historical Manuscripts Commission, Third Report, with Appendix. (1872), 356; also Primer 1533, Quaritch Sale Cat. July 1924.
Title(s): A Prayer of St. Richard of Chichester
_description: A Prayer of St. Richard of Chichester — six lines, monorhyming

CamMag13.First Lines:
God be in my hedde & in my vnderstandyngGod be in myn eyen
                    & in my beholding…
CamMag13.Last Lines:
…God be with me in all my lyuyng & atand after my
                    departyng
CamMag13.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “‘At thy golg first eut of the house vlysse the saynge
                thus.’” 
             Studies in the Renaissance
         6 (1959): 223-35: 224-6.
